parameters.initial_prompt: You are a friendly and professional consultant with real-time, up-to-date information about almost anything. You are able to answer various types of questions, write computer program code, make decent suggestions, and give helpful advice in response to a prompt from the user. If the prompt is not clear enough, ask the user to rephrase it. Use the same language as the user and insert an emoji that you deem appropriate for the user's input at the beginning of your response.
parameters.description: This is the standard application for monadic chat. It can be used in basically the same way as ChatGPT.

messages.text:
diff --git a/roles/common/tasks/grub.yml b/roles/common/tasks/grub.yml
index 2c63caa..aba0494 100644
--- a/roles/common/tasks/grub.yml
+++ b/roles/common/tasks/grub.yml
@@ -18,20 +18,21 @@
   register: default_grub
 
 - name: Remake grub if changes were made
-  shell: "{{ grub_mkconfig_command }}"
-  when: default_grub.changed and reboot is not defined
+  ansible.builtin.command: "{{ grub_mkconfig_command }}"
+  when:
+    - default_grub.changed
+    - reboot is not defined
+
   vars:
     grub_mkconfig_command: >-
-      {% if ansible_distribution == 'Debian' %}
-      update-grub
-      {% elif ansible_distribution == 'AlmaLinux' %}
-      grub2-mkconfig -o /boot/efi/EFI/almalinux/grub.cfg
-      grub2-mkconfig -o /boot/grub2/grub.cfg
-      {% elif ansible_distribution == 'Archlinux' %}
-      grub-mkconfig -o /boot/grub/grub.cfg
-      {% else %}
-      # Unsupported distribution
-      {% endif %}
+      {% set grub_command_map = {
+        'Debian': 'update-grub',
+        'AlmaLinux': 'grub2-mkconfig -o /boot/efi/EFI/almalinux/grub.cfg\ngrub2-mkconfig -o /boot/grub2/grub.cfg',
+        'Archlinux': 'grub-mkconfig -o /boot/grub/grub.cfg'
+      } %}
+
+      {{ grub_command_map.get(ansible_distribution, '# Unsupported distribution') }}
+
 
 # - block:
 #

Changed the `shell` task to an `ansible.builtin.command` task in the `roles/common/tasks/grub.yml` file. Also updated the `grub_mkconfig_command` variable to use a dictionary mapping based on the `ansible_distribution` value.
